header_summary:
In an analysis by Anthony Towns, the Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs) repository experienced a notable increase in activity following the introduction of new editors, highlighting the critical role of editor contributions in enhancing the repository's productivity. Jon Atack and Murch were identified as particularly active contributors during 2024 and 2025, emphasizing the importance of managing editorial roles to prevent burnout and ensure efficiency. The suggestion includes implementing term limits for editors and introducing an "apprenticeship" role to facilitate the involvement of new volunteers, aiming to maintain the vitality of the BIPs repository ([Source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/aJrSEOImKAa9NEB9@erisian.com.au/T/#m4294d050022bdd4c1c681ade3de7b3605d83be1a)).

Conduition criticized a proposed Bitcoin Improvement Proposal aimed at mitigating quantum computing threats to Bitcoin, arguing that it relies too heavily on centralized, legalistic solutions such as KYC procedures, which contradict Bitcoin's decentralized ethos. Instead, the correspondence advocates for a shift towards fostering a culture of cooperation among potential quantum adversaries and establishing ethical guidelines for entities with advanced quantum capabilities ([Source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/SN6PR12MB2735280A252DD62231D1320AA523A@SN6PR12MB2735.namprd12.prod.outlook.com/T/#m5f7fc61258555e97ea16fd419d3a7a00149ddb7c)).

Gmaxwell's exploration into the use of Minisketch for block relay processes highlights the efficiency of reconciling announcements over full mempool reconciliation, presenting a strategy that aligns bandwidth and decoding costs more closely. The discussion also considers future-oriented approaches like maintaining clones of peers' mempools to minimize block propagation delays, promising expedited block relay through highly efficient means while keeping memory usage minimal ([Source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/sharing-block-templates/1906/8)).

VigSeth proposed the development of a high-performance Layer 1 protocol, the "Twinstor Blockchain," utilizing a Proof of Useful Work consensus mechanism focused on matrix multiplication to support digital twin technologies across various industries. This initiative aims for an initial transaction throughput of over 1000 TPS, indicating a significant step towards scalability and performance in blockchain technology, with a whitepaper available for further details ([Whitepaper](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Xqfk99fbXz5ZSGiVSHeVhJi1bEUgCWuU/view?usp=sharing)).

recent_posts.title: New BIP Editors: 1 Year Later
recent_posts.summary:
- New editors' addition to Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs) led to increased merges in 2024.
- In 2025, a few editors were responsible for the majority of activity, showing workload concentration.
- The email proposes term limits and an "apprenticeship" role to prevent burnout and ensure vitality.

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] No burn, Quantum Migration Proposal, Quantum Secure Asset Verification & Escrow (QSAVE)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email criticizes a Bitcoin Improvement Proposal for its unrealistic, centralized defense against quantum threats.
- It opposes using KYC procedures for quantum security in Bitcoin, proposing a cooperative approach instead.
- The correspondence advocates for ethical guidelines and non-technical solutions involving quantum computing entities.

recent_posts.title: Sharing block templates
recent_posts.summary:
- Minisketch's efficiency in block relay is highlighted, focusing on quadratic complexity with set differences.
- Alternative strategies, like utilizing recent templates for edits, improve peer communication efficiency.
- Future approaches may involve nodes maintaining clones of peers' mempools to minimize block propagation delays.

recent_posts.title: New paper on Proof of Usable Work
recent_posts.summary:
- The collaboration focuses on a novel L1 protocol using PoUW for enhanced scalability.
- "Twinstor Blockchain" aims to revolutionize industries by enabling advanced digital twin technologies.
- A domain and whitepaper for "Twinstor Blockchain" signal readiness for development and collaboration.

recent_posts.title: Writing Simplicity Programs with SimplicityHL
recent_posts.summary:
- The integration of a universal sighash mode in Simplicity enhances security and flexibility.
- It requires intricate modifications and significant coding, emphasizing careful planning.
- Successful adoption could revolutionize blockchain application development and smart contract functionality.

active_posts.title: Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin
active_posts.summary:
- The debate on quantum computing's impact on Bitcoin focuses on cryptographic vulnerability and countermeasures.
- Discussions include ethical implications of quantum attacks and the balance of protecting or locking vulnerable funds.
- Technical and philosophical aspects of adapting Bitcoin's protocol to resist quantum threats are being explored.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Utreexo Nodes
active_posts.summary:
- Tadge Dryja, Davidson Souza, and Calvin propose three BIPs for Bitcoin, focusing on Utreexo.
- Their aim is to allow transaction verification without the entire UTXO set, enhancing efficiency.
- They seek community feedback via GitHub to refine these early-stage, collaborative proposals.

active_posts.title: [Draft BIP] Quantum-Resistant Transition Framework for Bitcoin
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal addresses Bitcoin's transition to quantum-resistant cryptography against future computing threats.
- It details a four-phase migration plan to enhance security and encourage widespread adoption with minimal disruption.
- The initiative favors SPHINCS+-SHAKE256f for its robust quantum-resistant properties and calls for community feedback.

active_posts.title: Correcting the error in getnetworkhashrateps
active_posts.summary:
- The current network hash rate calculation overestimates by a factor of N/(N-1).
- A proposed correction involves multiplying the estimate by (N-1)/N for accuracy.
- Adopting fixed-time block counting could align estimation with Poisson statistics.

active_posts.title: Exploring Extended Relative Timelocks
active_posts.summary:
- Discussions focus on extending Bitcoin's timelocks to ~10 years via the 65535-block limit.
- A proposed method suggests using bit 21 in `nSequence` for "long" timelocks, multiplying duration by 8.
- The initiative includes a tool for address creation, sparking debates on use cases and risks.

active_posts.title: Changing the minimum relay feerate
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests lowering Bitcoin Core's minimum relay feerate from 1000 sat/kvB to 100 sat/vB.
- The adjustment aims to address low-fee transactions' relay and mining alongside preventing DoS attacks.
- Discussions include the impact of Bitcoin's USD price on feerates and invite ecosystem feedback.

today_in_history_posts.title: Bitcoin XTs Tor IP blacklist downloading system has significant privacy leaks.
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin XT downloads Tor IP addresses for blacklisting, risking user privacy.
- Unmentioned feature is on by default, misleadingly named, and bypasses anti-DoS protections.
- Clearnet connections leak locations and identities, even with proxies or Tor-only settings.

today_in_history_posts.title: Loop attack with onion routing..
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell warns of a harmful Bitcoin Lightning Network attack involving payment routing.
- He suggests revealing route steps' hashes and using nonces for proof against such attacks.
- Russell seeks feedback on his solution, noting it may incur transaction fees as a drawback.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Passive and active investments are fundamentally different, involving varied levels of engagement and management.
- The post highlights issues with passive investment, such as the principal/agent problem and potential underutilization of assets.
- It suggests central banks could stabilize economies using a currency system backed by deflationary assets like Bitcoin.
